reviews.text:
Very small and unassuming coffee shop near the oldest HDB in Singapore (which is part of a heritage trail).

The butter Kaya toast is amazing! They were very generous and the drinks are cheap! $1.20 for Kopi / teh. Hard to find such price points in Singapore these days. The eggs are huge and opened for you!

There is a Malay food stall which is v popular too. Will try next time.
Good feel and vibes of a traditional coffeeshop. Sitting at the front drinking traditional coffee and enjoying the Kaya toast is an enjoyment .

I can only comment on the 1st malay stall (nearest the entrance) after eating here a few time. Food is authentic traditional taste, so good and very affordable. Seats are limited, so most customers buy n pack. Friday is filled with congregation from local mosque at lunchtime. I can eat here everyday!

Small coffee shop with a malay stall and drink/toast stall. Probably only 6 tables (4 seater) available. Continuous stream of customer buying the Malay food. Love the cute heart shaped toast with generous kaya and butter, half boiled egg was very very well cooked

Always packed during peak hours. Queue starts around 11am. Parking is a challenge. One of the most affordable Nasi Padang in town. Ordered beef, squid, fish, chicken wing, bean sprouts. All delicious! $14 for the spread? Very very affordable!
